fact: Carbohydrates provide 4 calories per gram.
Proteins provide 4 calories per gram.
Fats provide 9 calories per gram, making them the most calorie-dense macronutrient.
Alcohol provides 7 calories per gram, though itâ€™s not a nutrient.
Fiber is a type of carbohydrate your body cannot digest; it helps digestion and lowers cholesterol.
Vitamin A supports vision, immune function, and skin health.
Vitamin C is an antioxidant that boosts the immune system and aids collagen production.
Vitamin D helps calcium absorption and supports bone health.
Vitamin E acts as an antioxidant, protecting cells from damage.
Vitamin K is essential for blood clotting and bone health.
Calcium is crucial for strong bones and teeth.
Iron is necessary for hemoglobin production and oxygen transport.
Magnesium supports muscle and nerve function, and energy production.
Potassium helps regulate blood pressure and fluid balance.
Zinc supports immune function, wound healing, and DNA synthesis.
Water makes up around 60% of an adult human body, making it essential for life.
Unsaturated fats (like in olive oil, nuts, and avocado) are healthier than saturated fats.
Trans fats are unhealthy and increase the risk of heart disease.
Whole grains are richer in fiber and nutrients than refined grains.
Processed sugars provide energy but few nutrients and can contribute to obesity and diabetes if consumed excessively.
